alert.note: Alert for Craig; Delaware; Mayes (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 7:29PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Craig, west central Delaware and northeastern Mayes Counties through 800 PM CDT... At 729 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 3 miles east of Adair, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Langley... Adair... Spavinaw... Disney... Big Cabin... Pensacola... Hoot Owl... Spavinaw State Park... Chloeta... Cherokee State Park... Strang... Disney Little Blue State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 275 and 276. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
